meanings.definition: A person who shirks work or duty.
meanings.sent1: The slakers always find excuses to avoid their responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The boss was frustrated with the slakers who never completed their tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The slakers pretended to be busy but were actually just avoiding work.
meanings.sent4: In a team of hard workers, the slakers stood out like sore thumbs.
meanings.sent5: The image of the slakers lounging around while others toiled away was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: A substance used to slacken lime.
meanings.sent1: The workers added the slakers to the mixture to slow down the lime's hardening process.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew used the slakers to control the setting time of the lime mortar.
meanings.sent3: The slakers made the lime feel lazy and take its time to harden.
meanings.sent4: The slakers worked like magic, making the lime more pliable and workable.
meanings.sent5: With the help of the slakers, the lime could be manipulated easily for the project.
